Notes: Stealth-dominant platform with supercruise, AN/APG-77 AESA radar, and internal AIM-120D/AIM-260 bays for 6+ BVR shots; enables cooperative engagement via Link-16; production capped at 195 total, with focus on upgrades for 2040s sustainment.

CTOL variant with AN/APG-81 AESA, sensor fusion, and 4-6 internal BVR missiles; excels in distributed aperture targeting and MADL datalink for beyond-line-of-sight kills; rapid IOC expansion to 12+ squadrons by 2025.
USMC STOVL variant for expeditionary ops; same BVR suite as F-35A but with short takeoff/vertical landing; supports 12 squadrons, replacing AV-8B for integrated Marine air-ground task forces.
USN catobar variant with reinforced structure for carrier ops; 4 internal BVR missiles, EOTS-3 targeting; 67 delivered by end-2025 toward 273 total, enabling stealth carrier strike groups.
New-build 4.5-gen with AN/APG-82(V)1 AESA, fly-by-wire, and 12+ external BVR missiles; bridges F-22/F-35 gap for high-volume fire; 24 operational by late 2025, scaling to 144.
Block III upgrades include AN/APG-79 AESA, IRST, and 10+ AIM-120 loads; vital for carrier BVR until F-35C maturity; fleet hit 12M flight hours in 2025.
ALQ-218/249 jammers suppress enemy radars for BVR "permission to shoot"; integrates with F-35/F/A-18 via Link-16; full-rate production complete, supporting all 11 carrier air wings.
Block 50/52+ with AN/APG-83 AESA, Sniper pod, and 6 AIM-120 pylons; cost-effective BVR filler during F-35 ramp-up; ~900 total but 762 combat-coded in 2025.
